HAML and Partials

19 Jan 2016

When I started working on this Sinatra app, I told myself I wouldn’t turn it into Rails. That lasted all of about 20 minutes. I imediately realized I was missing a could things that I couldn’t do without.

HAML

Adding HAML support to a Sinatra app is pretty straight forward. First add the haml gem to your Gemfile.

Then require it in your config.ru.

No you can call the your .haml views in the application, instead of using the html tag.

Pretty easy!

Partials

What’s likely more interesting and usefull is setting up partials the way rails natively supports.

First you’ll of course need the sinatra-partial gem.

And require it.

Then you have to register and enable it within your app.

Now within views your abble to load partials similar to the way you do in rails.

I’ve set up a partial to drop media items into a view
